title: P05-1039

sentences.text: In this paper , we present an unlexicalized parser for German which employs smoothing and suffix analysis to achieve a labelled bracket F-score of 76.2 , higher than previously reported results on the NEGRA corpus .
In addition to the high accuracy of the model , the use of smoothing in an unlexicalized parser allows us to better examine the interplay between smoothing and parsing results .

summary: In this paper , we present an unlexicalized parser for German which employs smoothing and suffix analysis to achieve a labelled bracket F-score of 76.2 , higher than previously reported results on the NEGRA corpus . In addition to the high accuracy of the model , the use of smoothing in an unlexicalized parser allows us to better examine the interplay between smoothing and parsing results .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates a relationship where the subject provides or offers something to someone else, often in an official or formal capacity. This can include presenting research findings, introducing new ideas, offering solutions, or providing explanations.

Predicate-employs.label: employs
Predicate-employs.description: The predicate 'employs' indicates a relationship of utilization or application between the subject (an entity that uses or applies something) and the object (a method, technique, process, or resource being used). It suggests that the subject relies on, utilizes, or makes use of the object to achieve some goal or accomplish a task.

Predicate-achieves.label: achieves
Predicate-achieves.description: Indicates that the subject has successfully obtained or reached a specific goal or outcome described by the object.

Predicate-reports.label: reports
Predicate-reports.description: To report means to present or convey information about something that has been observed, studied, or discovered before. The subject of the predicate reports provides an account or summary of previously known facts, findings, or results, which are then presented as the object.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship of utilization or employment between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject makes use of, relies on, or employs the object to achieve some purpose or function.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is related to another more general or overarching concept, which is represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the subject has a higher-level category or classification within a hierarchical structure.
